entry.title: What is the difference between ref,out and in keywords in c#
224/365 | ¬•10M Job Challenge - What makes something valuable?
entry.summary: Everyone probably has a different definition, and depending on your perspective, the answer can vary. For influencers who use new AI features as part of their content, even if it has little to no practical value in the industry, the entertainment value alone can make it worthwhile. But for professionals who have been working for years and are actually applying AI in their jobs, these things are essentially just advertising. It‚Äôs not that they have no value‚Äîit‚Äôs just a different perspective. To me, even though the IT industry evolves rapidly, the things that fundamentally don‚Äôt change are what truly hold value. For example: Should we use AI to learn and improve work efficiency, or just dive into vibe coding, abandoning all the details‚Äîlike information security‚Äîand risk lawsuits and other consequences? Truly valuable things always take time to learn and apply. They need to be internalized and become part of you, enabling you to solve real-world problems‚Äînot just show short-term, surface-level results. In other words, the essence of AI is to raise everyone‚Äôs baseline capabilities, reduce repetitive tasks, and free up our attention for areas that are more meaningful. But that doesn‚Äôt mean it can‚Äîor should‚Äîcompletely replace humans. Rather than focusing solely on prompt engineering, we should prioritize communication and expression skills. Lately, I‚Äôve been spending less time on social media to reduce meaningless anxiety. It's better to invest that time in exploring tools that are actually useful and learning how to use them effectively.

entry.title: Understanding JWT: Basics, Security, and Use Cases
entry.summary: My previous blog posts covered topics like cookies and CSRF attacks. Today, I want to share what I've learned about JWTs --- a topic that came up during a job interview where I was asked about their security. Since it's quite a bit lengthy, this post will focus on the fundamentals of JWTs. What is JWT? How JWT Ensures Security Use Cases The Structure of JWT How JWT works What is JWT? JWT stands for JSON Web Token, an open standard (RFC 7519) for securely transmitting information between two parties, such as a client and a server. As the name implies, the data within a JWT is formatted as a JSON object. RFC 7519 JSON Web Token (JWT) is a compact, URL-safe means of representing claims to be transferred between two parties. The claims in a JWT are encoded as a JSON object that is used as the ‚Ä¶

entry.title: Enumeration in Java
Why We Stopped Using WordPress for Client Projects ‚Äî And Switched to Next.js + React (2025)
entry.summary: At Reactive Tech Solutions, we‚Äôve built 100+ websites for SMEs and professionals in Nancy, France. üõë In 2025, we completely ditched WordPress and CMS-based builds. Instead, we now rely exclusively on Next.js + React + Firebase/Vercel. ‚ùå WordPress: Still "Easy", but Not Viable Anymore Slow: heavy themes, plugin overload Security holes: outdated plugins and brute-force bots Plugin spaghetti: breaking updates, version conflicts SEO pain: no server-side rendering (SSR), poor LCP/INP Hidden costs: yearly theme/plugin fees + custom fixes üëâ Your ‚Äúfree‚Äù CMS can easily cost more than a modern stack within 12‚Äì18 months. ‚úÖ The Tech We Use: Next.js + React + Firebase Next.js ‚Üí SSG, SSR, fast routing React.js ‚Üí Reusable components, dynamic UI Firebase or Supabase ‚Üí Backend, auth, DB Vercel ‚Üí Serverless deploys, edge caching Tailwind + shadcn/ui ‚Üí Accessible, modern UI üì¶ Fully typed (TypeScript), tested, SEO-optimized, scalable. ‚ö° Why Clients Love It (Even if They Don‚Äôt Know the Stack) No plugin updates or maintenance headaches Pages indexed in minutes, not days Smoother UX = higher conversion Hosting = basically free with Vercel MVPs or full platforms can ship in days ‚Äî not months. üî• Real Client Results (France, 2024‚Äì2025) Volets Grand Est ‚Üí Bounce rate ‚Üì 35%, conversion ‚Üë 80% Opera for a Night ‚Üí +65% average session duration Our own site ‚Üí reactive-tech-solutions.com üß† Why It Works (Even for Non-Tech Clients) SSR + static export = perfect for SEO Firebase/Auth = fast secure forms & backend React components = scale as you grow We don‚Äôt fight plugins. We ship results. üì© Want to Work With Us? Loads instantly Looks sharp Ranks on Google Actually brings leads ‚Üí Visit https://reactive-tech-solutions.com/contact TL;DR ‚Äî The Stack Shift Thanks for reading! üôå https://reactive-tech-solutions.com/blog

entry.title: Cursor In Java
entry.summary:
In Java, the term cursor typically refers to objects used to traverse or iterate over elements in a collection, such as Iterator, ListIterator, and Enumeration. These are called cursor interfaces.
Cursor Type Introduced In Applicable Collections Traversal Modifications Direction
Enumeration JDK 1.0 Legacy classes (Vector, Hashtable) Read-only No Forward
Iterator JDK 1.2 All Collection types Yes Yes (remove()) Forward
ListIterator JDK 1.2 Only List types Yes Yes (add(), remove(), set()) Forward and Backward
import java.util.*;
public class EnumerationExample { public static void main(String[] args) { Vector<String> vector = new Vector<>(); vector.add("A"); vector.add("B");
Enumeration<String> enumeration = vector.elements(); while ‚Ä¶

entry.title: Cartify E-Commerce Web Application
entry.summary:
*Java | Spring Boot | MySQL | Docker | Stripe API
Developed a commercial-grade, full-stack e-commerce web application simulating real-world online shopping systems. Cartify features secure user authentication, product browsing, cart and order management, Stripe payment integration, and admin control for product and order handling. Deployed using Docker and Render with a cloud-hosted MySQL database (Aiven). Key Features: Role-based access (Admin/User) with Spring Security Stripe-powered online payments & email order notifications Admin dashboard for product/category/order management Responsive UI built with Thymeleaf, Bootstrap, and HTML/CSS Deployed via Render & Dockerized for environment consistency Check out here for live demo :

Real estate represents the world‚Äôs largest asset class and is projected to reach a value of $654.39 trillion this year, according to Statista. entry.title: AI agents are poised to be crypto‚Äôs next major vulnerability
entry.summary: AI agents in crypto are increasingly embedded in wallets, trading bots and onchain assistants that automate tasks and make real-time decisions. Though it‚Äôs not a standard framework yet, Model Context Protocol (MCP) is emerging at the heart of many of these agents. If blockchains have smart contracts to define what should happen, AI agents have MCPs to decide how things can happen. It can act as the control layer that manages an AI agent‚Äôs behavior, such as which tools it uses, what code it runs and how it responds to user inputs. That same flexibility also creates a powerful attack surface that can allow malicious plugins to override commands, poison data inputs, or trick agents into executing harmful instructions. Amazon- and Google-backed Anthropic dropped MCP on Nov. 25, 2024, to connec‚Ä¶

entry.title: Is World‚Äôs biometric ID model a threat to self-sovereignty?
entry.summary: The crypto industry is no stranger to controversy, yet few projects have drawn more scrutiny than Sam Altman‚Äôs World, formerly known as Worldcoin. Promising to verify human uniqueness through iris scans and distribute its WLD token globally, World positions itself as a tool for financial inclusion. However, critics argue the project‚Äôs biometric methods are invasive, overly centralized, and at odds with the ethos of decentralization and digital privacy. At the heart of the critique is the claim that biometric identity systems cannot be truly decentralized when they rely on proprietary hardware, closed authentication methods, and centralized control over data pipelines. ‚ÄúDecentralization isn‚Äôt just a technical architecture,‚Äù Shady El Damaty, co-founder of Holonym Foundation, told Cointelegra‚Ä¶

entry.title: What's the HYPE about? Hyperliquid's 'Solana' moment eyes 240% gains
entry.summary:
Key takeaways:
HYPE is mirroring Solana‚Äôs 2021 breakout structure, targeting a 240% rally by July.
Familiar crypto fractals suggest HYPE could spark similar momentum-driven hype.
Hyperliquid's native token, HYPE, is mirroring a strikingly similar price structure to Solana‚Äôs (SOL) early 2021 breakout‚Äîone that preceded a 300% rally. HYPE chart fractal targets 240% rally by July In January 2021, Solana broke out from a prolonged consolidation phase just as marketwide interest began accelerating. The breakout, highlighted by a decisive flip above key Fibonacci retracement levels, triggered a vertical rally that saw SOL jump to the 4.618 Fib retracement line at around $19 from roughly $4.90 in under two months, marking a 291% surge. SOL/USD daily price chart. Source: TradingView Fast forwar‚Ä¶

entry.title: Pakistan allocates 2,000MW power for Bitcoin mining and AI centers
entry.summary: Pakistan has allocated 2,000 megawatts of surplus electricity exclusively for Bitcoin mining and artificial intelligence centers. The move is part of a broader digital transformation plan spearheaded by the Pakistan Crypto Council and backed by the Ministry of Finance, according to a May 25 report by local news outlet 24NewsHD TV Channel. In the first phase, the government plans to channel excess power into AI infrastructure and crypto mining operations. Finance Minister Muhammad Aurangzeb said the decision is expected to attract billions in foreign investment while generating high-tech employment across the country. The initiative‚Äôs second phase will introduce access to renewable energy for mining operations, aiming to balance growth with environmental responsibility. Related: Trump-backe‚Ä¶

entry.title: Crypto investor charged with kidnapping, torturing an Italian for passwords
entry.summary: A Manhattan crypto investor is facing serious charges after allegedly kidnapping and torturing an Italian man in a disturbing bid to extract access to digital assets. John Woeltz, 37, was arraigned on Saturday in Manhattan criminal court following his arrest on Friday. He stands accused of holding a 28-year-old Italian man captive for weeks inside a luxury townhouse in Soho, reportedly rented for $30,000 per month. According to police reports cited by The New York Times, the victim arrived in the US on May 6 and was allegedly abducted by Woeltz and an accomplice. The attackers are said to have stolen the man‚Äôs passport and electronic devices before demanding the password to his Bitcoin (BTC) wallet. When he refused, the suspects allegedly subjected him to prolonged physical abuse. Source: ‚Ä¶

Rennick says Bitcoin will go to $1 million but is a ‚ÄúPonzi Scheme‚Äù ‚ÄúBitcoin will ultimately go to $1 million dollars. Why because it‚Äôs a Ponzi scheme whereby BlackRock will pump more and more dollars into a supply constrained product,‚Äù Rennick said. ‚ÄúWhat exactly will this product produce?‚Äù Rennick said. He added that Bitcoin (BTC) will produce ‚Äúabsolutely nothing‚Äù and Australia ‚Äúneeds real engineers not financial engineers.‚Ä¶

entry.title: Crypto ETFs won‚Äôt lose ‚Äòtheir luster‚Äô as wallet adoption grows ‚Äî Cathie Wood
entry.summary: ARK Invest CEO Cathie Wood says crypto exchange-traded funds (ETFs) will likely maintain their place in the economy, regardless of how widespread crypto wallet adoption becomes over the next decade. ‚ÄúI think ETFs are an important stepping stone because, you know, wallets seem so complicated, so much friction for consumers, they just wanna push a button,‚Äù Wood said at the Solana Accelerate event in New York on May 23. Wallets remain an insurance policy, says Wood ‚ÄúSo ETFs for those who want the convenience, I don‚Äôt think, will lose a lot of their luster,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúBut they will be a stepping stone into wallet-based.‚Äù Wood reiterated the extra layer of protection that crypto wallets provide: ‚ÄúThese are insurance policies against something going wrong in the traditional world.‚Äù Bitbo data s‚Ä¶

entry.title: Industry exec sounds alarm on Ledger phishing letter delivered by USPS
entry.summary: Scammers posing as Ledger, a hardware wallet manufacturer, are sending physical letters to crypto users instructing them to "validate" their wallets or risk losing access to funds, in the latest phishing attack to impact the industry. BitGo CEO Mike Belshe shared a picture of the scam letter, which featured a QR code, presumably linked to a malicious phishing site. The letter was sent through the United States Postal Service (USPS), according to the executive. "These are all scams do not fall for any of these," Troy Lindsey wrote after receiving a copy of the phishing letter. A copy of the scam Phishing letter. Source: Mike Belshe Cointelegraph reached out to Ledger for comment but was unable to obtain a response by the time of publication. This phishing attempt highlights the ever-evolvi‚Ä¶

entry.title: Wallet intelligence shapes the next crypto power shift
entry.summary: Opinion by: Scott Lehr, adviser to Alteri.io In the world of cryptocurrency, knowledge isn't just power ‚Äî it's a weapon. The recent collapse of Mantra's OM token, which saw a 90% drop in value within hours, underscores how wallet intelligence can be leveraged with devastating effects. Wallet intelligence is the real-time analysis of blockchain data to extract insights from wallet behaviors, transaction patterns, and asset flows. Firms like Chainalysis and Arkham Intelligence have turned raw onchain activity into high-resolution surveillance, enabling everything from compliance monitoring to predictive trading. This level of insight gives a strategic advantage to those who can access it. Power like this, however, has consequences. There is a new battlefield on the blockchain, and you might ‚Ä¶

entry.title: Hyperliquid trader James Wynn goes ‚Äòall-in‚Äô on $1.25B Bitcoin Long
entry.summary: Well-known Hyperliquid trader James Wynn has increased his 40x leverage long Bitcoin bet to $1.25 billion after closing his $PEPE position for a $25.2 million profit. On May 24, Lookonchain reported that Wynn entered an 11,588 BTC position with an average entry price of $108,243 and a liquidation level of $105,180. The move came hours after Wynn exited his Ether (ETH) and Sui (SUI) longs at a $5.3 million loss. At the time, he used the proceedings to double down on Bitcoin (BTC), increasing his position to 11,070 BTC. Wynn began his Bitcoin long position with $830 million on May 21, trimming $400 million in profits the same day. By May 22, he ramped the position back up to $1.1 billion, holding high leverage as BTC crossed $110,000 and gained $39 million on paper. He later sold 540 BTC for‚Ä¶

entry.title: Trump‚Äôs use of presidential seal at memecoin event raises legal questions
entry.summary: President Donald Trump is facing scrutiny after speaking at a private event for top investors in his $TRUMP memecoin while standing behind a lectern emblazoned with the official presidential seal ‚Äî a move that may violate federal law. The event took place Thursday at Trump National Golf Club in Virginia, where Trump addressed 220 investors in his cryptocurrency project. According to US law, the presidential seal cannot be used in any manner that could imply government approval or sponsorship. Violators can face fines or up to six months in prison. Trump, who arrived at the club aboard a military helicopter, praised attendees and took aim at the Biden administration‚Äôs crypto stance. When asked about potential conflicts of interest, White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt said the presi‚Ä¶

entry.title: Judge overturns fraud convictions in Mango Markets exploit case
entry.summary: A US federal judge has vacated key fraud and manipulation convictions against Avraham Eisenberg, the trader at the center of the case involving a $110 million exploit of the decentralized exchange Mango Markets. On Friday, US District Judge Arun Subramanian ruled that the evidence presented at trial failed to support the jury‚Äôs conclusion that Eisenberg made materially false representations to Mango Markets. The decision vacates Eisenberg‚Äôs convictions for commodities fraud and market manipulation and acquits him of a third charge, significantly weakening the government‚Äôs case. Eisenberg, a self-proclaimed ‚Äúapplied game theorist,‚Äù was convicted in 2024 for artificially inflating the price of Mango‚Äôs MNGO token by over 1,300% in a matter of minutes and using the resulting gains as collatera‚Ä¶

entry.title: Bitcoin ETFs post $2.75B in weekly inflows as price sits above $108K
entry.summary: US-based spot Bitcoin exchange-traded-funds (ETFs) have recorded a total of $2.75 billion in inflows this week amid Bitcoin surpassing its January all-time high of $109,000. The $2.75 billion in inflows is approximately 4.5 times larger than the previous week‚Äôs $608 million, according to Farside data. BlackRock Bitcoin ETF continues inflow streak On May 23, the final day of the trading week, spot Bitcoin (BTC) ETFs recorded $211.7 million in inflows. However, BlackRock‚Äôs IBIT was the only fund to post gains in the trading day, adding $430.8 million and extending its inflow streak to eight consecutive days. Grayscale‚Äôs GBTC led outflows with $89.2 million, followed by ARK 21Shares‚Äô ARKB with $73.9 million. Just two days before, on May 21, the Bitcoin ETFs saw $607.1 million in inflows, the ‚Ä¶

entry.summary: The current structure of capital markets is failing to serve a broad base of investors, according to Akshay BD, non-chief marketing officer at the Solana Foundation. During a panel at the Accelerate 2025 conference, Akshay argued that blockchain technology could help address these shortcomings, claiming that Solana could ‚Äúmake everyone an investor or a dreamer over time.‚Äù Akshay noted growing uncertainty among investors, citing concerns from investment managers who report heightened anxiety among clients. ‚ÄúYou have low bond yields, you have asset price bubbles, and people don't really know how the traditional asset allocation model works anymore,‚Äù he said. The 60-40 portfolio hasn‚Äôt delivered consistent returns in a long time.‚Äù He attributed some of this tension to a widening gap between i‚Ä¶

entry.title: Onchain privacy is a necessity in the age of AI ‚Äî Shielded CEO
entry.summary: Blockchain privacy tools such as zero-knowledge (ZK) proofs will become increasingly necessary to protect online user data in the age of artificial intelligence, according to Eran Barak, CEO of Shielded Technologies, the developer behind the Midnight privacy chain. In an interview with Cointelegraph at Consensus 2025, Barak said corporate service providers and centralized servers are expected to become honeypots for AI-assisted hackers and malicious actors looking to steal valuable data, including private keys, financial metadata, medical records, and government documents. Hackers targeting centralized entities have a "massive" return on investment (ROI) and are incentivized to hack centralized targets that contain millions of valuable records, the CEO told Cointelegraph. Barak added that ‚Ä¶

entry.title: Semler Scientific boosts BTC holdings with $50M purchase
entry.summary: Semler Scientific, a medical device company, purchased of $50 million worth of Bitcoin between May 13 and May 22, bringing the market value of the company‚Äôs Bitcoin (BTC) holdings to $474.4 million, keeping it within the top 13 of BTC Treasury companies. According to a May 23 disclosure, Semler bought a total of 455 BTC for an average purchase price of $109,801. To buy the Bitcoin, Semler Scientific used proceeds from an at-the-market stock offering program. So far, the company has sold roughly 3 million shares of common stock for net proceeds of $115 million. Semler Scientific‚Äôs shares have fallen 1.36% on the same day as the disclosure, though the decrease in its share price is largely in line with the Nasdaq‚Äôs performance. That index, which follows top tech stocks, is down 1% on the day. Semler Scientific share price. Source: Google Finance In its Q1 2025 earnings report released on May 13, the company revealed a 44% drop in revenue year-over-year. Despite the claimed success of its Bitcoin treasury plan, Semler Scientific‚Äôs shares have dropped 18% in 2025, according to Google Finance. Bitcoin treasury companies, or companies that traditionally sell equity or issue debt to buy BTC, had been drawing the interest of investors looking for exposure to Bitcoin price fluctuations. Michael Saylor's Strategy debuted its BTC reserve in August 2020, when it started purchasing Bitcoin. Bitcoin is up 181.6% year to date, while Semler Scientific shares rose 53% since announcing the BTC approach in May 2024. Magazine: ZK-proofs are bringing smart contracts to Bitcoin ‚Äî BitcoinOS and Starknet

entry.title: Texas governor signals support for Bitcoin reserve bill
entry.summary:
Texas Governor Greg Abbott has signaled support for a bill recently passed by the state House of Representatives that would establish a strategic cryptocurrency reserve. In a May 22 X post, Abbott posted a Techstory article about Texas state lawmakers‚Äô efforts to create a Bitcoin (BTC) reserve. The story pointed out that the decision for the passage of SB 21, the bill in question, now rests on Abbott‚Äôs shoulders, roughly three months after it was introduced.¬† Since taking office, Abbott referred to himself as a ‚Äúcrypto law proposal supporter‚Äù in 2021 and suggested that he would support policies to establish Texas as a ‚Äúcrypto capital‚Äù in 2024. Texas was one of a handful of state-level governments that proposed setting up a strategic crypto reserve after the 2024 federal elections.¬†¬†¬†
Rela‚Ä¶

entry.title: Crypto Biz: From shorting the Venezuelan Bolivar to shorting the US dollar
entry.summary: When Venezuela was experiencing hyperinflation, Ledn co-founder Mauricio di Bartolomeo hedged against the collapsing local currency by shorting it in favor of the more stable US dollar. Today, he‚Äôs using a similar strategy ‚Äî this time borrowing against his Bitcoin (BTC) to hedge against the crumbling US dollar. Di Bartolomeo connected with me during Canada Crypto Week in Toronto, where he talked about the advantages of Bitcoin-backed loans and the rapid growth of collateralized BTC lending. In our interview, he made a compelling case for continuing to stack sats, even as Bitcoin‚Äôs price keeps rising. This week‚Äôs Crypto Biz dives into our conversation with the Ledn co-founder and covers the latest business news from the blockchain world. A lesson from hyperinflation Before Bitcoin, di Barto‚Ä¶

entry.title: US House members call for investigation into Trump's memecoin dinner
entry.summary: Members of the US House of Representatives called for the Justice Department to investigate Donald Trump‚Äôs May 22 dinner for his top memecoin investors, citing concerns about ‚Äúforeign influence over US policy decisions‚Äù and ‚Äúpotential corruption and emoluments clause violations.‚Äù In a May 22 letter to the Justice Department, 35 House members asked the public integrity section acting chief, Edward Sullivan, to launch an inquiry over the memecoin dinner to determine whether it violated the federal bribery statute or the foreign emoluments clause of the US Constitution.¬† Under the emoluments clause, a US president is barred from accepting any gift from a foreign state without the approval of Congress. Bloomberg reported that a majority of the attendees at the memecoin dinner were likely forei‚Ä¶

entry.title: Bitcoin price ‚Äòbreather‚Äô expected as short-term traders realize $11.6B in profit
entry.summary:
Key takeaways:
Short-term Bitcoin holders realized $11.6 billion in profit over the past 30 days, suggesting a potential pause or local top in the market.
Technical indicators show cooling momentum as retail investor sentiment falls to a 90-day low and liquidity data points to price volatility.
Bitcoin (BTC) price recently hit a new all-time high of $111,800, but the bullish momentum may slow down as onchain data from Glassnode reveals significant profit-taking by short-term holders (STHs), potentially signaling a market "breather." Glassnode analysis shows that STHs, often considered traders rather than long-term investors, have realized a staggering $11.6 billion in profits over the last 30 days. This follows a sharp rebound in Bitcoin‚Äôs price, pushing past the STH cost-basis of $93,0‚Ä¶

entry.title: A new atomic clock in space could help us measure elevations on Earth
entry.summary: In 2003, engineers from Germany and Switzerland began building a bridge across the Rhine River simultaneously from both sides.
